New Records: Freddie Freeman homered for the third straight game in the World Series.
Walker Buehler pitched another World Series gem, combining with six relievers on a five-hitter.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers moved to a 3-0 series lead with a 4-2 victory over the Yankees.
Shohei Ohtani played despite a partially dislocated left shoulder.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were heavily anticipated to face the Yankees in a high-profile matchup.
Freddie Freeman's consistent performance was a key factor in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers were close to a series sweep, which would be their second championship in five years.
The victory highlighted the resilience and depth of the Dodgers' roster.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was significant for Shohei Ohtani's participation despite his injury.
The World Series was a best-of-seven format, with the Dodgers leading 3-0.
Others: The article provides context about the game's progress and significance in the series.
